gov.usgs.anss.mysql

Class MySQLConnectionThreadOld

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.mysql.MySQLConnectionThreadOld
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MySQLConnectionThreadOld
extends java.lang.Thread
    MySQLConnectionThreadOld.java This thread tries to keep a MySQL connection and statement open to a Mysql Database. If it is unsuccessful, it tries again ever 30 seconds. When successful, it checks every second for the connection to close. If it does, it tries to reopen it. The user can force a reopen with the reopen() method. As it is a thread a terminate() method is provided to allow the user a way to kill this thing. Each such MySQLConnectionThreadOld is named and it is an error to create another one of the same name. Each group of Threads using one of these should first use the static method getThread() to see if the named thread exists and use it before attempting to create a new one. In this way the returned object is always good for the life of the thread (though the connection may be down). If the user always uses the executeUpdate() and executeQuery() methods to do the SQL statements, they are synchronized and can safely use the same object. The intended user is one who needs to write to a Database from a thread and cannot tolerate the thread hanging up for long on DB stuff. Created on October 15, 2006, 4:05 PM

                                boolean ssl,
                                java.lang.String nm)
                         throws java.lang.InstantiationException
        create a thread which maintains a connection to a MySQL server and database
        Parameters:
        h - The host on which MySQL is running
        db - The name of the desired database for this connection
        u - The user name to log into MySQL with
        pw - The password for that user
        write - If true, this connection and INSERT and UPDATE records
        ssl - if true, use SSL on this connection
        nm - THe name to give this connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - Thrown if this connection cannot be built

      • waitForConnection

        public boolean waitForConnection()
        at startup the Thread may not yet have achieved a connection. This waits up to 5 seconds for a connection to be made. I
        Returns:
        True if the connection has been made, if false, the database is very busy or down.

        Parameters:
        name - The connection name to wait for
        Returns:

      • executeQuery

        public static java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String nm,
                                              java.lang.String sql)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This executes a query on the named MyQLConnectionThread. It looks up the thread in a static list and then uses the instance executeQuery() to perform the query.
        Parameters:
        nm - The name of the MySQLConnectionThreadOld to use
        sql - An sql query statement
        Returns:
        The ResultSet from the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - after doing a reopen to clear up any problems

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String sql)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This executes a give SQL query in this thread. It is synchronized so that many different threads can use this object to performed transactions over a single MySQL connection.
        Parameters:
        sql - An sql query statement
        Returns:
        The ResultSet from the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - after doing a reopen to clear up any problems

      • executeUpdate

        public static int executeUpdate(java.lang.String nm,
                                java.lang.String sql)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        This executes a sql update on the named MyQLConnectionThread. It looks up the thread in a static list and then uses the instance executeUpdate() to perform the update.
        Parameters:

        sql - An sql query statement
        Returns:
        The ResultSet from the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - after doing a reopen to clear up any problems

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(java.lang.String sql)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        This executes a give SQL update in this thread. It is synchronized so that many different threads can use this object to performed transactions over a single MySQL connection.
        Parameters:
        sql - An sql query statement
        Returns:
        The ResultSet from the query or -1 if a duplicate entry occurred or -2 if a data Truncation occurred.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - after doing a reopen to clear up any problems

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Cause the connection to be shutdown and closed. Normally the user would call this when a SQLStatement caused an exception (in particular for no connection) to force the Thread to make a new one.

      • close

        public void close()
        close and forget a coonnection and drop it from the list

      • reopen

        public boolean reopen()
        Cause the connection to be shutdown and closed. Normally the user would call this when a SQLStatement caused an exception (in particular for no connection) to force the Thread to make a new one.
        Returns:
        true if reopen was successful

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        this shuts down all open MySQLConnections. It should be called as part of a main exit handler. It can be called by multiple shutdowns. Only the first one will have any affect.
